title: Supreme Court Backs Trump Admin in Cutting DEI-Linked Grants
snippets: But the court, in its emergency-docket order, left in place by a 5-4 order a lower court ruling that threw out National Institutes of Health memos that enforced the administration's policies.
SCOTUS decision impacts DEI programmes that include breast cancer research and HIV prevention.
Supreme Court lets Trump slash DEI grants at NIH&nbs
Supreme Court sides with Trump on cutting government grant programs involving diversity, equity and inclusion.
The decision could result in the loss of National Institutes of Health grants worth hundreds of millions of dollars.

Court, in 5-4 split, lifts judge’s order blocking $783m in cuts made by NIH to align with president’s priorities

The Trump administration can slash hundreds of millions of dollars’ worth of research funding in its push to cut federal diversity, equity and inclusion efforts, the supreme cour
titles: Supreme Court allows NIH to stop making nearly $800M in research grants for now
US Supreme Court rules Trump admin can cut nearly $800m in health funding
Supreme Court lets Trump slash DEI grants at NIH - Axios
Supreme Court says Trump may cancel DEI-related health research grants
Supreme Court Allows Trump To Cut Millions In DEI-Related Health Grants
Supreme court allows Trump officials to cut research millions in anti-DEI push
summary: The Supreme Court, in a 5-4 decision, sided with the Trump administration to cut government grant programs that involve diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI), impacting areas such as breast cancer research and HIV prevention. This ruling upheld a lower court's decision to invalidate National Institutes of Health (NIH) memos enforcing these policies, potentially leading to the loss of NIH grants worth hundreds of millions of dollars.

title: Judge Orders Closure of "Alligator Alcatraz" Detention Center in 60 Days
snippets: A federal judge issued a preliminary injunction Thursday halting further expansion and ordering the winding down of an immigration detention center built in the middle of the Florida Everglades.
The order gave the Trump administration 60 days to wind down operations at the site, with no new detainees allowed.
A federal judge is ordering the Trump administration and Florida to effectively wind down operations at the immigrant detention center known as “Alligator Alcatraz."

Judge’s order finds jail, which has attracted waves of criticism, was causing severe harm to Florida Everglades

A federal judge in Miami late on Thursday ordered the closure of the Trump administration’s notorious “
The ruling sided with environmental groups and the Miccosukee Tribe, who had filed a suit alleging that the facility built in the Florida Everglades violated federal environmental laws.
titles: Florida must stop expanding 'Alligator Alcatraz' immigration center, judge says
US judge orders shutdown of Trump's 'Alligator Alcatraz' detention centre
Judge blocks transfers to 'Alligator Alcatraz,' effectively winding down operations
Federal judge orders closure of Trump’s ‘Alligator Alcatraz’ immigration jail
Federal Judge Orders ‘Alligator Alcatraz’ To Be Shut Down Within 60 Days—No New Detainees
summary: A federal judge has ordered the closure of the immigration detention center known as "Alligator Alcatraz" located in the Florida Everglades, giving the Trump administration 60 days to cease operations. The decision comes after environmental groups and the Miccosukee Tribe sued, arguing the facility violated federal environmental laws and caused severe harm to the ecosystem. The judge's ruling prohibits any new detainees and mandates the winding down of the center.

title: Court Overturns $464M Fine Against Trump in Fraud Case, Upholds Other Sanctions
snippets: Trump, in a social media post, claimed "total victory" after the ruling, which spares him from a potential half-billion-dollar fine for decades of exaggerating his wealth.

A New York appeals court has ruled that US President Donald Trump will not be required to pay a $515 million (around €443 million) civil fraud penalty, eliminating one of his biggest financial liabilities.

<a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMigwFBVV95cUxOQ24xSk9ONUdRVGh4T1NlNXdWUFVta3R2YWdlalExb2Z4SWpNOXJvN2FvbEdocjBSeElPc0J5Vm5VRGpqWEhTeDlrallRakI1LUVJbG50X2J6UC0tR1R1M0ZoUnRVZzMwaXFRZ3Zwc2JVeGZOUGZsbW56RVpQeVpNR3dIRQ?oc=5" target="_blank">President Trump's massive civil fraud penalty jus
A New York appeals court has thrown out the half billion-dollar civil fraud judgment handed down last year against President Trump, his family and his company.

Divided decision by New York appeals judges dismisses ‘excessive’ penalty but leaves room for further appeals

A New York appeals court has thrown out the massive civil fraud penalty against
titles: An appeals court throws out a massive civil fraud penalty against President Trump
US court throws out massive fraud penalty against Trump
President Trump's massive civil fraud penalty just got tossed out - Axios
WATCH:  NY appeals court throws out civil fraud judgment against Trump
Court throws out $500m civil fraud penalty against Donald Trump
summary: A New York appeals court has overturned a $464 million fine against President Donald Trump in a civil fraud case, deeming it excessive and likely a violation of the US Constitution. The case, filed by New York State Attorney General Letitia James, accused Trump of inflating his assets to secure favorable terms from lenders and insurers. While the court dismissed the financial penalty, it upheld other sanctions against Trump, his family, and his company. This decision represents a significant legal victory for the President amidst ongoing legal challenges.

title: Jaylen Brown's Father Charged with Attempted Murder in Las Vegas

summary: Quenton M. Brown, the father of Boston Celtics star Jaylen Brown, was arrested and charged with attempted murder in Las Vegas. The charge stems from an incident where he allegedly stabbed a youth football coach following an argument over a parking situation.

title: Lil Nas X Arrested, Hospitalized After LA Altercation with Police

The Grammy Award-winning rapper was taken to hospital for a suspected overdose after a brief struggle with police. He was held in jail and booked on suspicion of obstructing an officer.

Lil Nas X has been arrested and briefly hospitalized after an altercation with police in the early hours of Thursday morning, according to authorities in Los Angeles.

titles: Lil Nas X arrested and taken to hospital after wandering LA streets in underwear

summary: Lil Nas X, a 26-year-old rapper and singer, was arrested and briefly hospitalized following an altercation with police in Los Angeles early Thursday morning. He was seen walking down the street in his underwear before the incident. Authorities expect to charge him with misdemeanor battery on a police officer, as reported by NBC Los Angeles.

Retaliatory strike against gerrymandered maps in Texas now heads to voters in a special election this November

California governor Gavin Newsom on Thursday signed a sw
If approved by voters, the California redistricting could nullify five new U.S. House seats Republicans are expected to gain from a new redistricting map in Texas.
titles: Newsom signs California redistricting measures in response to Texas bill - Axios
Newsom signs redistricting proposal to reshape congressional map in favor of Democrats
Newsom Sends Redistricting Proposal To California Voters To Counter GOP’s Texas Redistricting
summary: California Governor Gavin Newsom signed legislation targeting gerrymandered maps in Texas, setting up a special election in November for voters to decide. If passed, this measure could counteract the expected gain of five U.S. House seats by Republicans under a new Texas redistricting map.

title: Musk Sought Zuckerberg's Help for $97.4B OpenAI Buy, Court Docs Reveal
snippets: In early 2025, xAI CEO Elon Musk asked Meta's Mark Zuckerberg to help him finance a $97.4 billion takeover of OpenAI, new court filings revealed.
Tesla billionaire made offer for ChatGPT maker’s core business in February
Elon Musk wanted Mark Zuckerberg to join him in his bid to buy OpenAI, the startup said in a court filing on Thursday.
titles: Elon Musk asked Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg to join xAI bid to buy OpenAI, filing shows
Musk tried to enlist Zuckerberg in $100bn bid for OpenAI
Musk tried to get Zuckerberg on board to buy OpenAI, says the AI company
summary: In early 2025, Tesla CEO Elon Musk sought financial assistance from Meta's CEO Mark Zuckerberg for a $97.4 billion acquisition of OpenAI, the creator of ChatGPT. This information was disclosed in recent court documents. Musk's proposal to Zuckerberg aimed at purchasing OpenAI's main operations was made in February, as stated in a court filing.

title: Colombia's President Petro Terms Dissidents, Cartels as 'Terrorists'
snippets: Colombian President Gustavo Petro says armed dissidents, drug trafficking cartels should be considered 'terrorists'.
Colombian authorities have blamed the two incidents on separate dissident factions of FARC, the disbanded leftist guerrilla group.
A wave of attacks by armed groups across Colombia this year has left Colombians fearing a return to the country’s more violent past.
titles: At least 18 killed in Colombia in drone attack on helicopter, car bombing
Colombia: truck bomb, helicopter downing kill at least 17
Truck bomb and helicopter downing in Colombia leave at least 13 dead
summary: Colombian President Gustavo Petro has labeled armed dissidents and drug trafficking cartels as 'terrorists,' attributing recent violence, including two incidents, to factions of the disbanded FARC guerrilla group. This surge in attacks has sparked concerns among Colombians of a potential return to the nation's historically violent periods.

title: Steelers Beat Panthers 19-10 in Preseason Finale; Key Players Shine
snippets: Harmon, the No. 21 pick, appears to have avoided a serious injury based on initial feedback
Skylar Thompson, Yahya Black, Scotty Miller, and three more Steelers highlight the top performances in the Week 3 preseason win over the Panthers.

Skylar Thompson completed 11 of 13 passes for 152 yards, including a 24-yard touchdown strike to Lance McCutcheon, rookie Ben Sauls kicked four field goals, and the Pittsburgh Steelers beat the Carolina Panthers 19-10 on Thursday night in the preseason finale.
titles: Derrick Harmon injury: Steelers first-round pick carted off with knee sprain in preseason game vs. Panthers
6 Steelers standouts from preseason Week 3 win over Panthers
Steelers top Panthers in pre-season finale, lose Harmon to knee injury
summary: In the preseason finale, the Pittsburgh Steelers secured a 19-10 victory over the Carolina Panthers, with notable performances from Skylar Thompson, Yahya Black, Scotty Miller, and three other Steelers. Thompson completed 11 of 13 passes for 152 yards and a touchdown, while rookie Ben Sauls contributed with four field goals. Additionally, Harmon, the No. 21 draft pick, has reportedly avoided a serious injury according to initial feedback.

title: Erik Menendez Denied Parole 36 Years After Parents' Murder
snippets: The younger of the Menendez brothers, who killed their parents in their Beverly Hills mansion, can try again for parole in three years.
Erik and his brother Lyle were convicted of the killings and sentenced to life without parole in 1996. Lyle's parole hearing is set for Friday.
Erik Menendez was denied parole during his first-ever parole hearing on Thursday, 36 years and one day after he and his brother killed their parents.
titles: Erik Menendez denied parole three decades after killing his parents
US: Erik Menendez denied parole after parents' murder
Erik Menendez denied parole 36 years after murdering his parents
summary: Erik Menendez, convicted alongside his brother Lyle for the murder of their parents in their Beverly Hills home in 1989, was denied parole at his first hearing since their sentencing to life without parole in 1996. The decision came 36 years and one day after the crime. Erik is eligible to reapply for parole in three years, while Lyle's parole hearing is scheduled for Friday.

title: Judge Disqualifies Trump Lawyer Alina Habba from Case Over Appointment Issue

Judge says Alina Habba, Trump's top federal prosecutor in New Jersey, not lawfully appointed
summary: Alina Habba, previously a lawyer for Donald Trump and acting as the U.S. Attorney for New Jersey, was disqualified by a judge from overseeing a case. This decision came after criminal defendants challenged her authority, citing her appointment as "unlawful." The Trump administration has not adhered to a July ruling from a panel of judges that mandated replacing Habba as the interim U.S. attorney.

title: SEC to Adopt Nine-Game Football Schedule in 2026 for Enhanced Competition

The development comes on the heels of the College Football Playoff committee updating its metrics

SEC adopts nine-game conference slate starting in 2026 as CFP metrics shift emphasis on schedule strength
summary: The SEC announced a shift to a nine-game conference football schedule beginning in 2026. This decision follows the College Football Playoff committee's update on metrics. The change aims to enhance competition within the conference.

Report: Astros signing veteran reliever, nine-time all-star Craig Kimbrel
summary: The Houston Astros have signed former All-Star relief pitcher Craig Kimbrel. Kimbrel will be joining the team's major-league roster, as reported by ESPN's Jeff Passan. This move marks a significant addition to the Astros' bullpen and provides them with an experienced and talented pitcher.

title: Henley Leads Tour Championship Opening, Scheffler Close Behind
snippets: Scottie Scheffler sits second, two shots off the Tour Championship lead, after a stunning nine-under 61 from Russell Henley in the race for the FedExCup.

ussell Henley hardly missed a putt. Scottie Scheffler hardly missed a fairway. They led a parade of players who seized on the soft conditions at East Lake to begin the race for the Tour Championship and the season-ending FedEx Cup title.
titles: Scheffler two off Tour Championship lead as Henley cards opening 61
Russell Henley birdies last 3 holes for 61 to lead Tour Championship over Scheffler
summary: Russell Henley and Scottie Scheffler led the opening round of the Tour Championship, taking advantage of soft conditions at East Lake. Henley leads after a remarkable nine-under 61, with Scheffler two shots behind following a 63. Other notable performances included Fleetwood and MacIntyre each shooting a 64. The event marks the final race for the season-ending FedExCup title, with players like Rory McIlroy also in contention, despite being five shots off the lead after an opening 66.

title: Millie Bobby Brown and Jake Bongiovi Adopt Baby Girl

summary: "Stranger Things" actress Millie Bobby Brown and her husband, Jake Bongiovi, have shared their joy in becoming parents after adopting a baby girl. The couple, aged 21 and 23, tied the knot in 2024.

This approach aids fantasy managers in making strategic choices for their teams.
